result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy R Hellinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine & costs paid from bond through Clerk of Court with the exception of $8.00.  Said balance to be paid to the Clerk of Courts.

Obtain Domestic Violence assessment through a certified (WBTP) Wisconsin batterer's treatment provider and followthrough with all treatment recommendations.
No contact with Carol P. unless approved by Agent.
Submit DNA sample.

DA moves to amend the Bailjumping from a felony to a misdemeanor.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to amended charge.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Arguments as to penalty.  Court orders:  30 days jail imposed and stayed, 18 months probation with conditions.
Defendant Billy R Hellinger in court with attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has no additional witnesses.
Subpoena for 3/30/2016 - Jury Trial
State's Witness List
No contact with C.P. directly or indirectly in custody or not. Def. to get address forwarding in at the post office today. Marvin Beachy may pick up the Def.'s mail at C.P. address.

Defendant Billy R Hellinger in court with Attorney Steven Edward Weerts.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Weerts addresses the court. Def. is seeking amendment to his bond to allow Marvin Beachy to pick up his mail from the victim's address. Atty. Parker doesn't object however, he wants the court to order the Def. to file a "change of address" at the post office today. Court modifies the bond to allow Marvin Beachy to pick up the Def.'s mail at victim's address and orders the Def. to file a "change of address" form at the post office today.
Pre-trial conference at 12-02-2015 09:45 am
